metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1243 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Use-after-free vulnerability in the MutationObserver::disconnect function in core/dom/MutationObserver.cpp in the DOM implementation in Blink, as used in Google Chrome before 42.0.2311.135, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact by triggering an attempt to unregister a MutationObserver object that is not currently registered.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1243` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089
chromium-browser-l10n - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089
chromium-chromedriver - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.6.6-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.6.6-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.6.6-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqmlscene - 1.6.6-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.6.6-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.6.6-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.6.6-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089').
oxide-qt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.6.6-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
